title: Business & Finance
text:
A media outlet backed by China's market regulator highlighted administrative action taken against Walmart for alleged cybersecurity infractions.

---

The Fed's Clarida disclosed additional sales of shares in broad-based stock funds, drawing fresh scrutiny of financial transactions he conducted at the onset of the pandemic.

---

GameStop is launching a division to develop a marketplace for nonfungible tokens and establish cryptocurrency partnerships.

---

U.S. stocks closed lower after a choppy session, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq both losing 0.1% and the Dow shedding 0.5%.

---

Samsung Electronics is forecasting a roughly 52% jump in its fourth-quarter operating profit from the year-earlier period.

---

Apple CEO Cook received almost $100 million in compensation in 2021, a year in which he led the iPhone maker to record profits.

---

Google infringed audio patents held by Sonos and is barred from importing some of its Nest audio speakers and other violating products, a U.S. trade agency ruled.

---

Walgreens said sales and profit rose in its latest quarter and the chain raised its full-year forecast.
